Summary I run global social marketing at Intel. OG content marketer and fellow designer of Intel's global approach to new media. Long-time early-stage builder of all things digital. My career focuses on the evolution of Media + Brand + Technology. 
 
I managed Intel's award-winning partnership w/ VICE Media forming "The Creators Project". http://thecreatorsproject.vice.com/ 
 
Awarded as "2014 Content Marketer of the Year" by the Content Marketing Institute. 
 
In 2006, I designed and built Intel’s social platform establishing communications, legal, security and authored Intel's Social Media Guidelines that integrated social media into Intel’s marketing mix. 
 
Starting in 2001, I led a 4-year research project with MIT that researched online trust and digital marketing strategies. I also designed many high profile sections of Intel’s web systems. 
 
A frequent speaker on digital innovation at the Yale Center for Customer Insights, the MIT Center for Digital Business, SxSW, the Marketing Sciences Institute, etc. 
 
I'm a marketing professor at Portland State University where I teach Advanced Digital Media. I sit on the Executive Board of the Center for Consumer Research at St. Joseph’s University, the Marketing Advisory Track at Northeastern University and a member of the City Club of Portland.  
 
@bryanrhoads - http://twitter.com/bryanrhoads
